abstract: The European Central Bank left its benchmark interest rate unchanged on Thursday, and its president, Jean-Claude Trichet, expressed cautious optimism that the sovereign debt crisis was easing and that the euro area economy was growing faster than expected.
snippet: The European Central Bank left its benchmark interest rate unchanged on Thursday, and its president, Jean-Claude Trichet, expressed cautious optimism that the sovereign debt crisis was easing and that the euro area economy was growing faster than ...
lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank on Thursday left its benchmark interest rate unchanged, and its president, Jean-Claude Trichet, expressed cautious optimism that Europe’s sovereign debt crisis was easing and that the euro area economy was growing faster than expected.

headline.main: Recovery Sees European Banks Leave Rates Alone
